name: Telco Customers Segmentation  Analytical App
description: Build ML Model to create customer segments

appStages.name: Introduction
appStages.stageDetails:
{ "components": [ { "label": "HTML", "attrs": [ { "attr": "", "value": "" } ], "content": "

Customer Segmentation Analytics

Overview

This app can be used to check the profile of customer data and the relation between the various features included in it. It also performs clustering on raw telecom customer data and creates clusters of customers based on inferred groupings.

Input

Users provide:

  • + Feature filters for monthly revenue, number of roaming calls, months in service and the number of dropped calls for the customer data to perform specific exploratory data analysis
  • + Selection of features to be used in the clustering model, type of clustering to perform and a model name
  • + A validation dataset (see schema below) to test the clustering model and perform predictive-segmentation analysis

Output

The app delivers:

  • + Exploratory Data Analysis of the provided data, including various meaningful visualizations
  • + Clustered customer segment groups on validation data, detailed predictive and segmentation analysis

Benefits

  • + Uncover hidden patterns and relationships within customer data.
  • + Identify and address the needs of different customer groups, leading to higher satisfaction.
  • + Create more effective campaigns by understanding distinct customer segments.

Data Description

Field Name Description
CustomerID A unique identifier for each customer in the dataset.
Churn Indicates whether the customer has churned (Yes/No). This is the target variable for predictive modeling.
MonthlyRevenue The monthly revenue generated from the customer.
MonthlyMinutes The total number of minutes used by the customer in a month.
TotalRecurringCharge The total recurring charges billed to the customer.
DirectorAssistedCalls The number of calls where the customer required director assistance.
OverageMinutes The number of minutes used beyond the allotted plan.
RoamingCalls The number of calls made while roaming.
PercChangeMinutes The percentage change in minutes used compared to the previous period.
PercChangeRevenues The percentage change in revenue compared to the previous period.
DroppedCalls The number of calls dropped during usage.
BlockedCalls The number of calls blocked by the service.
UnansweredCalls The number of calls that went unanswered.
CustomerCareCalls The number of calls made to customer care.
ThreewayCalls The number of three-way calls made by the customer.
ReceivedCalls The number of calls received by the customer.
OutboundCalls The number of outbound calls made by the customer.
InboundCalls The number of inbound calls received by the customer.
PeakCallsInOut The number of calls made or received during peak hours.
OffPeakCallsInOut The number of calls made or received during off-peak hours.
DroppedBlockedCalls The number of calls that were either dropped or blocked.
CallForwardingCalls The number of calls forwarded by the customer.
CallWaitingCalls The number of calls where the customer used the call waiting feature.
MonthsInService The number of months the customer has been with the service.
UniqueSubs The number of unique subscriptions associated with the customer.
ActiveSubs The number of active subscriptions for the customer.
ServiceArea The geographic service area of the customer.
Handsets The number of handsets used by the customer.
HandsetModels The number of different handset models used by the customer.
CurrentEquipmentDays The number of days the current equipment has been in use.
AgeHH1 The age of the primary household member.
AgeHH2 The age of the secondary household member.
ChildrenInHH Indicates whether there are children in the household (Yes/No).
HandsetRefurbished Indicates whether the handset is refurbished (Yes/No).
HandsetWebCapable Indicates whether the handset is web-capable (Yes/No).
TruckOwner Indicates whether the customer owns a truck (Yes/No).
RVOwner Indicates whether the customer owns an RV (Yes/No).
Homeownership Indicates whether the customer owns a home (Yes/No).
BuysViaMailOrder Indicates whether the customer buys via mail order (Yes/No).
RespondsToMailOffers Indicates whether the customer responds to mail offers (Yes/No).
OptOutMailings Indicates whether the customer has opted out of mailings (Yes/No).
NonUSTravel Indicates whether the customer travels outside the US (Yes/No).
OwnsComputer Indicates whether the customer owns a computer (Yes/No).
HasCreditCard Indicates whether the customer has a credit card (Yes/No).
RetentionCalls The number of retention calls made to the customer.
RetentionOffersAccepted The number of retention offers accepted by the customer.
NewCellphoneUser Indicates whether the customer is a new cellphone user (Yes/No).
NotNewCellphoneUser Indicates whether the customer is not a new cellphone user (Yes/No).
ReferralsMadeBySubscriber The number of referrals made by the customer.
IncomeGroup The income group of the customer.
OwnsMotorcycle Indicates whether the customer owns a motorcycle (Yes/No).
AdjustmentsToCreditRating The number of adjustments made to the customer's credit rating.
HandsetPrice The price of the handset used by the customer.
MadeCallToRetentionTeam Indicates whether the customer made a call to the retention team (Yes/No).
CreditRating The credit rating of the customer.
PrizmCode A code representing the customer's demographic segment.
Occupation The occupation of the customer.
MaritalStatus The marital status of the customer.

      "content": "\u003cdiv class\u003d\"introduction\"\u003e\r\n  \u003cdiv class\u003d\"header\"\u003e\r\n    \u003ch3\u003eSegment Customers on Custom Data\u003c/h3\u003e\r\n  \u003c/div\u003e\r\n  \u003csection\u003e\r\n    \u003cul\u003e\r\n      \u003cli\u003e\u003cspan\u003e+\u003c/span\u003e This is the validation stage of the model you previously trained. Upload a CSV file conforming to the schema aforementioned. Press \u0027Segment\u0027 to segment the validation data. You can choose a type of analysis to perform and press \u0027Analyze\u0027 to run the same.\u003c/li\u003e\r\n    \u003c/ul\u003e\r\n  \u003c/section\u003e\r\n\u003c/div\u003e",

    },
